benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host back into rotation

covered: PUT Method - Valid Request: Success path returning 204 with no body and state change verified (TC01); idempotent behavior when already in rotation (TC02).
Authorization: Proper handling of 401 (unauthenticated) and 403 (insufficient privileges), including missing auth headers (TC03, TC04, TC09).
Concurrency Issues: Concurrent PUT requests complete without race conditions (TC14).
Resilience/Availability: Service down/unreachable returns 503 (TC05); transient network interruption with retry (TC13); degraded performance with timeout expectation (TC10).
HTTP Semantics: Method not allowed for GET returns 405 (TC06); empty response for 204 validated (TC01/TC02).
Request Variants: Extra headers tolerated (TC08); unexpected payload behavior defined (TC07); basic security hardening against header injection attempted (TC12).
gaps: PUT Method - Partial Update/Unexpected Body: Requirement says request body N/A; tests accept a non-empty body with 204 (TC07). If bodies are not allowed, add rejection scenarios (400) or unsupported media type (415).
Error Handling Depth: No explicit coverage for 500 Internal Server Error or upstream 502/504 responses and their payload structure/headers.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No scenarios verifying behavior under burst traffic limits (e.g., 429 with Retry-After).
Content Negotiation/Headers: No checks for Accept/Content-Type correctness (e.g., 204 should not include Content-Type; non-204 errors should return application/json).

Non-Existing Resource Semantics: If the API can target a specific host/node (clustered deployments), there is no scenario for unknown/decommissioned host (404/409); if always local-only, this should be clarified and marked N/A.
HTTP Method Coverage Breadth: Only GET->405 is tested; missing 405 for POST/DELETE/PATCH to this endpoint.
recommendations: Clarify expected behavior when a request body is sent. If disallowed, add tests asserting 400 Bad Request or 415 Unsupported Media Type when body or Content-Type is provided; if allowed/ignored, document that behavior explicitly.
Add server error simulations to verify 500 responses (and 502/504 if applicable) with proper JSON error shape and headers.
Introduce rate limiting tests to validate 429 Too Many Requests with Retry-After (if service enforces throttling).
Add content negotiation checks: ensure no Content-Type header on 204; verify application/json and error schema for non-204 error responses; test behavior with unsupported Accept.
If clustering/remote targeting exists, add scenarios for unknown/decommissioned host (404) and conflict states (409). If not applicable, note this as N/A in the test suite.
Add 405 coverage for other disallowed methods (POST/DELETE/PATCH) on this path to complete method constraints.
